alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 27 at 1:24PM MDT until March 28 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST AND EAST-CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG SOUTHWEST WIND, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH TUESDAY LATE MORNING THROUGH AFTERNOON FOR THE NORTHEAST AND EAST-CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO VERY STRONG SOUTHWEST WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... .Widespread critical fire weather conditions are likely Monday as the flow aloft strengthens ahead of an approaching storm system. Relative humidity values in eastern portions of the state will drop into the single digits while high temperatures climb to between 15 to 20 degrees above average. Additionally, a very unstable airmass/Haines Index of 6 is also forecast Monday afternoon. The same areas have the potential to see critical fire weather conditions again Tuesday with much stronger southwest winds ahead of a Pacific cold front along with relative humidity values in the low to mid teens. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM TO 8 PM MDT MONDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 2 PM to 8 PM MDT Monday. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued from Tuesday morning through Tuesday afternoon. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast and east-central plains. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest at 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph Monday afternoon through early evening. For Tuesday, potential southwest winds 40 to 50 mph with gusts up to 65 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...5 to 9 percent Monday and 13 to 18 percent Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is highly discouraged.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
